info.name: Turn API
info.description:
Welcome to the Turn API. Our API is designed to make it easy for you to automate the initialization and management, of all your screening needs. Our API is a modern REST API and can easily be consumed with any programming language.

## Authentication

Turn uses JSON Web Tokens (JWT) keys to allow access to the API. Before making any requests to the API you must request a token. Please request a token by contacting your sales representative.
# 
All API requests to the Turn API must include the JWT in an Authorization header. The format of the header is described below:


    Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>

Where *Authorization* is the header name, and *Bearer jwt_token* is the header value.

> You must replace jwt token with your personal API key.

request.description: Issue a simple request to validate your JWT Token. This endpoint will give back your correct Account name if the provided token is valid. In no Authorization header is present a 401 http response will be issued. If the token is invalid a 400 http response will be issued.

The Asynchronous Person Search endpoint is the most basic way to initiate a background check. It's a two way process:

1. This endpoint is called with the necesary details to invite a candidate to do a background check.

2. When the background check is completed, the results will be posted back to your provided URL. 

Rather than returning an inline response, requests made to this endpoint will return a unique UUID as a response. The full person response will then be returned asynchronously via HTTP POST to an endpoint that is specified as an additional callback_url parameter in the original requrest.

The UUID will be included as an additional key:value pair in the response, in order to tie requests back to their responses.

|Parameter			|Required	|Type			|Description
|:-----------		|---------  |------			|-----------
|first_name			|true		|`string`		|Legal first name of the person to check
|last_name			|true		|`string`		|Legal last name of the person to check
|email				|true		|`string`		|The email of the person to check
|phone_number		|false		|`string`		|Mobile phone number of the person to check
|email_candidate	|false	(defaults to `true`)|`boolean`	|Boolean value to indicate whether Turn should initiate the invitation via email (and via sms if a phone number was provided)
|callback_url		|true		|`string`		|A URL endpoint to which the background results will be POSTed asynchronously
|reference_id		|false		|`string`		|An arbitrary metadata value that can be passed. It will be returned in the response and also visible on the background report in your Turn Dashboard
|package_id			|false		|`string`		|The id of the package this check will use
|redirect_url		|false		|`string` 		|After completion of the background check flow, the candidate will be redirected to the provided URL
|do_checks		|false	(defaults to `true`)|`boolean` 		|If true starts the background check right away after the candidate consents, if false puts the check in a standby mode to be started at a later date using the `worker_id` provided in the response.



## About *email_candidate*
If you want Turn to initiate the communication with the candidate to start the background check, specify this flag in `true`. Marking this flag as `false` means you want to control the communication with your candidate. Use the `candidate_consent_url` response parameter to show your candidate the personalized consent form to start the background check, you can send this link using an internal communication channel (email, slack, etc) or embed the link inside a web application of your own or even a mobile app.

## About *do_checks*
If *do_checks* is specified as `false` the background check won't be started right away after the candidate consents. The check will be in an _initiated_ status which means:

* The check won't appear in your Turn Dashboard (until it's requested)
* You won't be charged for this check if it's never initiated
* The candidate won't be notified/sent any communication

If not specified, do_checks will always be `true`

To request the execution of the background check the /person/\<worker_id\>/run endpoint.


## About *phone_number*
If a phone number is specified and `email_candidate` is set to `true`, we'll also send a TEXT invitation (alongside the email). We'll send reminders as well, if we detect that the background check hasn't been started. 

## About *package_id*
If you are configured with multiple packages, you can pass in the ID of the package here. The package_id is an 11 character string starting with a ‘P’ and followed by 10 digits. If no package_id is passed, the configured default package will be used.

## Consent Form Prepopulation
first_name, last_name, email and phone_number will be used to prepopulate the candidate_consent_url the candidate will receive to start the background check form.

response.name: 200 Success
422 Missing required field

variable.description: Worker id as provided in the search_async endpoint.

request.description:
For candidates that have already been invited to start a background check, but hasn't completed the initial consent form where they provide all their information and legal consent to kick off the background check, this endpoint resends the original invitation with the personalized link to complete the consent form.

If the candidate has already filled the consent form, or the background check was initialized without an invitation a 422 http resonse with a corresponding error message will be provided.

If the turn id doesn't match any of your candidates a 404 http status will be issued.

variable.description: Worker id as provided in the search_async endpoint.

response.name: 205 Checks have already run

variable.description: Worker id as provided in the search_async endpoint.
Worker id as provided in the search_async endpoint.
Turn id of the candidate for whom an email invitation will be resent

request.description:
For candidates that have already been invited to start a background check, but hasn't completed the initial consent form where they provide all their information and legal consent to kick off the background check, this endpoint resends the original invitation with the personalized link to complete the consent form.

If the candidate has already filled the consent form, or the background check was initialized without an invitation a 422 http resonse with a corresponding error message will be provided.

If the turn id doesn't match any of your candidates a 404 http status will be issued.

variable.description: Turn id of the candidate for whom an email invitation will be resent
Turn id of the candidate for whom an email invitation will be resent

response.name: 422 No invitation sent

variable.description: Turn id of the candidate for whom an email invitation will be resent

request.description:
This is the first step in the End to End flow, hitting this endpoint means the intention of running a check, not the actual check. Two parameters are provided, zip code and package id, with those parameteres a comprehensive response is given, stating: 

1. All requiered inputs to start the background 
2. All visual elements (including legal disclosures) that should be displayed to the user


|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|zipcode			|true		|`string`		|The zip code of the candidate’s current address
|package_id			|true		|`string`		|The id of the package this check will use

## Displaying Legal Texts and Gathering the Consent Document

In order for Turn to legally run the background check, you need to present all the legal text to the user, the disclosures are provided in the `disclosures` section of the first POST /fcra_check/form call.

Please also note that all sections under the `disclosures` element have a set of checkboxes that the user needs to agree with.

Use this table as a reference on how to display the disclosures to your user, and the expected behaviour and flow control.

| Section                                   | Checkbox                                                                     | Guide                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|-------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Welcome                                   | "I certify that this is me,..."                                              | Please make sure the links work correctly for TOCs and PP Don't let the user continue if this checkbox is not clicked.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Welcome                                   | "I do not have a middle name"                                                | Can be optional if you already cover this logic in your UI. Please set the correct value in the candidate inputs "no_middle_name" (true if the candidate doens't have a middle name, false if there is a middle name, note that the API requires a middle name, if no_middle_name==false) |
| A Summary of your rights                  | I have read and understood the summary of my rights                          | Don't let the user continue if this checkbox is not clicked.                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Disclosure                                | "I have read and understood the disclosure regarding background information" | Don't let the user continue if this checkbox is not clicked.                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| A Summary of Your State Rights            | "I want to receive a copy of my Background Report"                           | For some states, we are legally obligated to show this option, we always send a copy of the BGC, so we must show this box for compliance reasons, no need to pass this value back.                                                                                                        |
| A Summary of Your State Rights            | "I have read and understood the summary of my rights"                        | Don't let the user continue if this checkbox is not clicked.                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Authorization of Background Investigation | "By clicking this checkbox, I indicate my agreement to all of the above."    | Don't let the user continue if this checkbox is not clicked.                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

Note that the section "A Summary of Your State Rights" is only required by certain states, and specific language can vary from state to state, we encapsulate this complexity, the disclosures section of this endpoint response will include or not the section "A Summary of Your State Rights" and the correct language for each state.

## About *package_id*
If you are configured with multiple packages, you can pass in the ID of the package here. The package_id is an 11 character string starting with a ‘P’ and followed by 10 digits. If no package_id is passed, the configured default package will be used.

response.name: 201 Success
422 Missing required field

variable.description: Check Id as provided in the /fcra_check/form endpoint

request.description:
This is the second step in the End to End flow, hitting this endpoint actually runs the background check with the provided inputs.

All inputs as named in the */fcra_check/form* endpoint are meant to be passed as parameters to this endpoint.


|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|first_name					| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| Legal first name of the person to check
|last_name					| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| Legal last name of the person to check
|no_middle_name				| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `boolean`	| true if the person doesn't have a middle name, false if they do have one
|middle_name				| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| Middle last name of the person to check
|date_of_birth				| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| Date of birth of the person to check in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD
|zipcode					| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| Zip code of the candidate’s current address
|phone						| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| Mobile phone number of the person to check
|ssn						| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| Social Security Number of the person to check
|email						| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| Email of the person to check
|gender						| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| M for male or F for female
|drivers_license_number		| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| The driver's license number of the person to check
|drivers_license_state		| As specified in /fcra_check/form	| `string`	| The driver's license state of the person to check (CA, NY, etc)
|consent_document			| mandatory							| `string`	| Base64 encoded png of the consent document of the person to check
|callback_url				| mandatory							| `string`	| An URL endpoint to which the background results will be POSTed asynchronously
|do_checks					| optional (defaults to `true`)		| `boolean`	| If true starts the background check right away, if false puts the check in a standby mode
|reference_id					| optional		| `string`	| An arbitrary metadata value that can be passed. It will be returned in the response and also visible on the background report in your Turn Dashboard
|timestamps	| optional (will be required soon)		| `json object`	| A set of timestamps that define the exact point in time when a candidate interacts with the legal disclosures.
|metadata| optional (will be required soon)		| `json object`	| Information about the device and location of the candidate consenting to the background check.



## About *do_checks*

If *do_checks* is specified as `false` the background check won't be started right away. The check will be in an _initiated_ status which means:

* The check won't appear in your Turn Dashboard (until it's initiated)
* You won't be charged for this check if it's never initiated
* The candidate won't be notified/sent any communication

If not specified, do_checks will always be `true`

## About *reference_id*

If *reference_id* is provided, the background check will be tagged with that specific reference. This could be any arbitrary text reference, it can be used to identify any particular background check with an internal id or candidate. If a background check is tagged with a *reference_id* it will be displayed in the Turn Dashboard, it will be included in all webhook communications and invoicing.

## About *timestamps* and *metadata*

A strong consent process requires information about how and when a candidate provided consent to be screened. 

### timestamps

A series of disclosures are presented in the the first call to POST /fcra_check/form. Every disclosure is a section that the candidate should consent to. Each section has a key (welcome, summary_of_rights..) and these same keys should be provided in the timestamps section along with the corresponding time of each event.

The timestamps provided should be UTC ISO-8601 and they reflect the time the candidate accepted each section of the disclosures.

### metadata

Metadata states information about the device and location of where the consent was required.

* ip_address - Should be the one of the applicant consenting to the background check.
* user_agent - Should be any string that identifies the browser user agent or the mobile application version.

response.name: 422 check id has already been used
422 Missing required field

variable.description: Check Id as provided in the /fcra_check/form endpoint

request.description: If a background check was initiated via the _/fcra_check/form/:check_id_ endpoint and it was requested not to start right away using the _do_checks_ flag as `false`, use this endpoint to start the background check with the previously provided information.

Check Id as provided in the /fcra_check/form endpoint
Full worker UUID or it's shortened version (aka Turn Id)

request.description:
This endpoint gives back the current status of the specified candidate.

## worker_id
The provided worker id can be any of:

1. The full UUID of the worker eg:  d54eb469-d74d-450a-b7f9-b0d98f55ac9e
2. The shortened version, also called turn id:  C1704355400

response.name: 422 Worker not found

variable.description: Full worker UUID or it's shortened version (aka Turn Id)

request.description:
Use this endpoint to get the complete detailed background check, it's status along all candidate's information and check results.

## worker_id
The provided worker id can be any of:

1. The full UUID of the worker eg:  d54eb469-d74d-450a-b7f9-b0d98f55ac9e
2. The shortened version, also called turn id:  C1704355400

## 422 Background Check not ready

If you request the background check of a candidate that hasn't provided the initial consent, an 422 http estatus will be issued along with a detailed message. No information is available at this point since the candidate hasn't provided the initial input to start the background check.

## About Background Check completion

If you request the details of any processing-bacground check a `warning` message will be included in the response, stating that no action should be taken against this candidate, for it's report is still being processed and any infractions you see in the report are not final. You can also look for the `complete` flag that will always be delivered in the same response, if `true` the background check is already done, and ready for you to take action if needed, if `false` the background check is still being processed.

response.name: 200 Success

variable.description: Full worker UUID or it's shortened version (aka Turn Id)

item.name: Webhooks
Sourcing
item.description:
If you are using Turn's Sourcing product, and you have setup correctly a _Webhook URL_ in your Settings > Integrations section in your Turn Partner Dashboard, the following webhooks describe what events and contents are sent. 

## a) Applicant Sourcing Conversion

The Applicant Sourcing Conversion_ webhook is triggered when an applicant converts (accepts) a Job Invite you initiated via Sourcing. This event is sent for every applicant that converts.


### Webhook content

```javascript
{
  "name": "Hari Seldon",
  "first_name": "Hari",
  "last_name": "Seldon",
  "email": "hari@foundation.io",
  "zipcode": 61601,
  "phone_number": "12345678900",
  "dob": "29/06/1987",
  "state": "CA",
  "city": "San Diego",
  "timestamp": "2020-11-10 00:23:25.884827",
  "event_name": "SOURCING_NEW_CANDIDATE",
  "preferences": {
    "interests": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Delivery"
      },
      {
        "id": 2,
        "name": "Moving"
      }
    ],
    "transports": [
      {
        "id": 7,
        "name": "Bike"
      },
      {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "Van"
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

Please note:
* Turn reserves the right to adjust the preferences name(interests and transports), matching by ID is encouraged.
* There could be candidates that choose not specify this information, so you should be prepared to process an empty list.


## Preferences > Transports Catalog
|id|transport|
|-|:---------:|
|1|Car|
|3|Walk|
|6|Motorcycle|
|7|Bike|
|8|Pickup Truck|
|9|Van|
|2|Box Truck|
|4|Public|

## Preferences > Interests Catalog
|id|interest|
|-|:---------:|
|1	|Delivery|
|3	|Pets|
|4	|Mealsharing|
|5	|Driving|
|6	|Babysitting|
|7	|Home Services|
|9	|Education|
|10	|Creative Services|
|11	|Security|
|12	|Storage|
|13	|Cooking|
|14	|Brand Ambassador|
|15	|Fashion / Beauty|
|16	|Device Repair|
|17	|Personal Training|
|18	|Software Testing|
|19	|Personal Assistant|
|20	|Secret Shopper|
|21	|Tour Guide|
|22	|Real Estate|
|8	|Medical Services|
|2	|Moving|
|24	|Cleaning|
|23	|Caregiving|

Some webhooks are sent from Turn to your system on specific events, here is the listing of those webhooks, how to configure them, and what the responses look like.

## a) Candidate status update

The _Candidate Status Update Webhook_ is triggered when a candidate of yours is moved from one status to another. Let's consider a common flow:

* From emailed to consent
* From consent to processing
* From processing to pending
* From pending to approved

In this case 4 webhooks would be triggered one for each status change.

### Webhook content

```javascript
{
  "team_member_email": "contact@turning.io",
  "original_state": "pending",
  "dashboard_url": "http://partners.turning.io/workers/623580e8-9a76-462f-acc9-2a190be182fa",
  "event_id": "11c42854-364e-481e-8e9b-22c21e9edeea",
  "state": "approved",
  "timestamp": 1527800278,
  "worker_email": "alec@sadtech.ca",
  "worker_id": "623580e8-9a76-462f-acc9-2a190be182fa"
}
```


## b) Background Check Results

The _Background Check Result webhook_ is triggered when an API initiated background check is completed, this means that the results are available and the status of check is either `approved`  or `pending`. The endpoints that trigger are: 

/person/search_async
/fcra_check/form/:check_id

Both endpoints use a `callback_url` input parameter which will be used to deliver the webhook.

### Webhook content

```javascript
{
  "checks": {
    "location": null,
    "addresses": [
      {
        "address1": "2195 Harris Heights Suite 287",
        "county": "South Lauren County",
        "state": "MD",
        "zip": "38942",
        "city": "Lake Hollystad",
        "zip4": "8705"
      }
    ],
    "aliases": null,
    "criminal": [
      {
        "county": "Other Counties",
        "value": [
          {
            "ssn": null,
            "first_name_match": "ExactMatch",
```

item.name: Workforce

variable.description: Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check

request.description:
The Profile endpoint is responsible for collecting basic worker information. You should provide this information once a worker is accepted and able to start working on your platform.
If the worker updates their information (a new email address, phone number or name), you should provide the updated information through the API to update our records.
The following attributes are passed as parameters to this endpoint: 



|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|first_name			|true		|`string`		|Legal first name of the worker
|last_name			|true		|`string`		|Legal last name of the worker
|email			|false		|`string`		|Valid email of the worker
|phone_number			|false		|`string`		|Mobile phone number of the worker, 11 digits. (ex. 18645404931)

variable.description: Turn Id as provided one turn processed a background check
Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check

request.description:
The Task endpoint holds the information about all tasks completed by the worker.

## About *task_type*
Valid types (delivery, pet-care, mealshare, ride-share, child-care, home-services, education, creative-service, security, storage, cooking, brand-ambassador, fashion-beauty, device-repair, personal-trainer, software-testing, personal-assistant, secret-shopper, tour-guide, real-state, medical-delivery, moving, cleaning, caregiving).



The following attributes are to be passed as parameters to this endpoint:



|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|id			|true		|`string`		|Unique id for the task record
|type			|true		|`string`		|Type of task (e.g. “delivery”, “pet-care”, “child-care”, etc)
||||See about task_type for full list of available types
|status         |true	|`string`		|Status of the task (“completed”, “canceled”)
|canceled_by   |Optional ( if status is canceled)		|`string`		|Cancelation requested by (“worker”, “customer”)
|start_location.lat			|false  	|`float`		|Latitude of geo point where the task started (pickup-location for delivery and ridesharing, address-location for services and care)
|start_location.lng			|false		|`float`		|Longitude of geo point where the task started
|start_location.formatted_address			|false		|`string`		|Address line where the task started (with city, state & zip)
|end_location.lat			|false		|`float`		|Latitude of geo point where the task finished
|end_location.lng			|false		|`float`		|Longitude of geo point where the task finished
|end_location.formatted_address			|false		|`float`		|Address line where the task finished (with city, state & zip)
|distance			|false		|`float`		|Distance travelled for task (lat / lng of start vs. lat / lng of end) in miles
|start_date			|false		|`datetime`		|Timestamp when the task started
|end_date			|false		|`datetime`		|Timestamp when the task finished
|duration			|false		|`integer`		|Duration of the task in minutes
|num_task			|false		|`integer`		|Number of tasks completed in this assignment (defaults to 1)

variable.description: Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check
Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check

request.description:
The Address endpoint provides the address of the worker.
If the worker updates their information, you should provide the updated address through the API to make sure our records are always up to date.
The following attributes are passed as parameters to this endpoint: 



|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|postal_code	|true		|`string`		|Zip code of the worker’s current address
|city			|false		|`string`		|City of the worker’s current address
|state		|false		|`string`		|State of the worker’s current address, 2 characters  (“CA”, “NY”)
|country			|false		|`string`		|Country of the worker’s current address in 2 character ISO (“US”, “CA”)
|address_ln			|false		|`string`		|Street address as a single string (“123 Main Street Apt A”)

variable.description: Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check
Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check

request.description:
The Vehicle endpoint collects information about transportation modes for the worker.
If the worker updates their modes of transportation, you should provide the update through the API to update our records.

## About *type*
Valid types: car, walk, motorbike, bicycle, pickup-truck, van, truck, public-transport. If you have a vehicle type not listed, contact support@turning.io


The following attributes are to be passed as parameters to this endpoint: 


|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|id			|true		|`string`		|Unique id for the vehicle record
|type	    |true		|`string`		|Type of vehicle. See “About type” to see available values.
|make		|false		|`string`		|Make or brand of the vehicle
|model		|false		|`string`		|Model of the vehicle
|year		|false		|`integer`		|Year of the vehicle was made
|identification_number		|false		|`string`		|Vehicle identification (license plate) number
|identification_state		|false		|`string`		|Vehicle identification (license plate) state, 2 characters (“CA”, “NY”)
|doors			|false		|`integer`		|Number of doors the vehicle has (2, 4)

variable.description: Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check
Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check

request.description:
The Payout endpoint tracks the income a worker has earned.
The following attributes are to be passed as parameters to this endpoint: 


|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|id			|true		|`string`		|Unique id for the payout record
|status	    |true		|`string`		|Status of the payment (“completed”, “canceled”)
|type		|true		|`string`		|Type of payment (“check”, “cash”, “direct_deposit”)
|payout_date		|true		|`date`		|Payment date
|currency		|true		|`string`		|Currency of the payment in 3-letter ISO (“USD”, “CAD”)
|gross_pay		|false		|`float`		|Income before taxes and fees
|deductions		|false		|`float`		|Taxes and fees amount
|net_pay		|false		|`float`		|Payment amount after deductions
|hours		|false		|`float`		|Hours worked involved in the paycheck
|tasks		|false		|`integer`		|Total of tasks performed in the payment cycle

variable.description: Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check
Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check

request.description:
The Career endpoint stores information about a worker’s career history.
The following attributes are to be passed as parameters to this endpoint:  


|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|signup_date			|Optional (only the first time)		|`datetime`		|Date when the worker initially signed up for a worker account
|length_at_work	    |false		|`integer`		|Days since first activity date(II)
|total_hours_spent_working		|false		|`integer`		|Total hours completing tasks.
|first_activity_date		|false		|`datetime`		|Date when the first task was completed(II)
|last_activity_date		|false		|`datetime`	|Date when the last task was completed(II)


II. If you are passing Task information using the Tasks endpoint, this value will be calculated based on the worker’s task history.

variable.description: Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check
Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check

request.description:
The Reputation endpoint tracks a worker’s performance and reputation.
The following attributes are to be passed as parameters to this endpoint:  


|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|rating			|true		|`float`		|Customer ratings in range of 5 to 0
|acceptance_rate    |true		|`float`	|Acceptance rate of offered tasks in range of 1 to 0

variable.description: Turn Id as provided once turn processed a background check

request.description:
The external profile endpoint is responsible for collecting worker information regardless previous background checks.

The following attributes are passed as parameters to this endpoint:


|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|first_name			|true		|`string`		|Legal first name of the worker
|last_name			|true		|`string`		|Legal last name of the worker
|email			|false		|`string`		|Valid email of the worker
|phone_number			|false		|`string`		|Mobile phone number of the worker, 11 digits. (ex. 18645404931)
|date_of_birth			|false		|`date`		|Valid date of birth of the worker
|address			|false		|`Address`		|Valid address object*
|vehicle			|false		|`Vehicle`		|Valid vehicle object*
|task			|false		|`Task`		|Valid task object*
|payout			|false		|`Payout`		|Valid payout object*
|reputation			|false		|`Reputation`		|Valid reputation object*
|career			|false		|`Career`		|Valid career object*

## About *address*
Please refer to the Address endpoint.
## About *vehicle*
Please refer to the Vehicle endpoint.
## About *task*
Please refer to the Task endpoint.
## About *payout*
Please refer to the Payout endpoint.
## About *reputation*
Please refer to the Reputation endpoint.
## About *career*
Please refer to the Career endpoint.

item.description:
Turn centralizes data on each worker to define a unique job profile consisting of identity and performance data.
Partners provide this information to Turn through the Workforce API.

## About *turn_id*
The turn_id is the unique id provided by Turn through the screening of a candidate. This unique id is an 11 character string starting with a ‘C’ and followed by 10 digits (ex. C1279030625).
The Turn ID is required to be specified in the URL indicated as <turn_id> in the documentation. 
If the Turn ID is not included, the information will not be correctly shared.

## About record *id*
Some records posted have a unique id. These unique ids are the identifiers generated by your system and do not need to follow a specified format. They can be sequential numbers or an alphanumeric UUID system.

item.name: Recheck

variable.description: Turn ID

request.description: To trigger a recheck, a call to this endpoint should be made, using any valid Turn ID.

variable.description: Turn ID
Turn ID
Turn ID

response.name: 422 Invalid candidate status

variable.description: Turn ID

item.description:
Recheck enables you to re-run the background check for any specific worker. Worker's consent won't be required again, so the background check will be initiated right away.

Conditions:
The worker should already have a completed background check (Approved, Consider or Rejected).

request.description:
Our Onboarding API is an easy way to receive Turn Applicants in your existing onboarding funnel.

To set up an onboarding flow first we would need to create one. The following attributes are passed as parameters to this endpoint:

|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|name			|true		|`string`		|Onboarding flow name
|steps			|true		|`list`		|List of steps to follow on your onboarding flow with its name and order

If later you need to add a step to your onboarding flow you can do it. The following attributes are passed as parameters to this endpoint:

|Parameter			|Required	|Type		|Description
|:-----------		|:---------:|------:	|:-----------
|name			|true		|`string`		|Onboarding step name
|onboarding_id		|true		|`string`		|Onboarding id
|order			|true		|`integer`		|Order in which you want to set your onboarding step

response.name: 400 Wrong step order
response.body: "Steps order needs to be consecutive numbers starting from 0"

request.description: Use this endpoint to get all your onboarding flows.

response.name: 200 Success

request.description: Use this endpoint to get all your onboarding flows steps.
